sender.senderstreetaddress: Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corp. Bldg 419, One Health Plaza

medicalhistoryepisode.patientmedicalcomment: Postoperative period – complicated by the bleeding from the transplanted kidney area .

reaction.primarysourcereaction: Right lung’s apex tumour – calcified lesions in the left lung’s apex
Blood pressure increased to 170/100 mm Hg
Shingles of the right intercostal space
Small oedema of the right lower limb

summary.narrativeincludeclinical: Case number PHHY2012PL113175 is an initial spontaneous report received from a healthcare professional on 05 Dec 2012. The report refers to a 76-year-old patient of unspecified gender. The current condition of the patient included arterial hypertension, ischemic heart disease, graves-basedov disease post radioiodine therapy and pulmonary tuberculosis. On an unspecified date in 1999, the patient developed a kidney disease that led to renal failure, underwent hemodialysis from 2002 to 2004 and kidney transplantation on 28 Dec 2004. After transplantation, the condition was complicated by bleeding from the transplanted kidney area. The lab data of the patient showed creatininaemia with creatinine levels of 714 습mol/l, 799 습mol/l, 483 습mol/l, 252 습mol/l and 291 습mol/l on 28 Dec 2004, 30 Dec 2004, 03 Jan 2005, 06 Jan 2005 and 14 Jan 2005 respectively. During hospitalization, the patient developed an incident of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation probably due to high dose of concomitant medication Euthyrox. TSH level was controlled and the dose of Euthyrox was decreased to 100 mcg daily. This polymedicated patient received treatment with Sandimmun Neoral (ciclopsorin) at a dose of 300 mg BID after kidney transplantation from an unspecified date and was diagnosed with diabetes mellitus and radiculopathy on an unspecified date in Mar 2005. On 06 Apr 2005, the patient got hospitalized with lumbar pain and nerve roots compression. In May 2005, the patient was diagnosed with osteoporosis with Th12-L2 compression fracture, discopathy and degenerative lesions L3-S1. The dose of concomitant medication Encorton was decreased to 5 mg daily. In Aug 2005, Encorton was shifted to Ostenil, the dose of Neoral was decreased to 75+100 mg and CyA level was 116 ng/ml. In Oct 2005, the blood pressure of the patient increased to 170/100 mm Hg. Amlozek at a daily dose of 5 mg was added In May 2006, Dopegyt tablet at a dose of 0.5 DF BID in Aug 2006. The patient developed shingles of the right intercostal space in Mar 2007. In May 2007, Ostenil was shifted to Bonviva. The patient was diagnosed with positive pANCA Ab in Aug 2007. The patient developed heart palpitations in Nov 2007, CyA level was 123 ng/ml and the dose of Neoral was decreased to 75 mg BID. In Feb 2008, azathioprine treatment was shifted to Myfortic at 360 mg BID. In Mar 2008, the patient got hospitalized with bronchitis. In Oct 2008, the patient developed lumbar pains and small oedema of the right lower limb. The patient also developed hypotension on an unspecified date and received treatment with Lokren, Inhibace and Spironol. In Dec 2009, the dose of Neoral was decreased to 75+50 mg and CyA level was 79-130 ng/ml. The patient developed generalized tonico-clonic epilepsy episode and received treatment with Depakine Chrono in Sep 2011, subsequent epileptic episode in Nov 2011 that led to increase in Depakine Chrono dose to 500 + 1000 mg. In Jan 2012, creatininaemia increase to 250 습mol/l. On 24 Apr 2012, the patient developed another epileptic episode with urination and right hand injury (surgically treated). The chest X-ray taken on the same day revealed right lung’s apex tumour – calcified lesions in the left lung’s apex. On 26 Apr 2012, dyspnea and generalized weakness developed and pulmonary auscultation revealed vesicular sound. The suspicion of lung cancer was made on 20 Jun 2012 and Certican therapy at a dose of 0.75 mg BID was introduced. The patient received treatment with Glucobay for diabetes mellitus, Profenid for radiculopathy, Doxar for blood pressure increased, Heviran for shingles. The chest X-ray taken in Jul 2012 showed presence of a tumorous lesion located in the apical and posterior segments of the right lung’s upper lobe. Tumour had irregular, slightly polycyclic contours; heterogeneous post intravenous contrast enhancement. Inside tumour, areas of worse blood supply possibly corresponding with tumour disintegration effect were visible. Tumour was in contact with pleura at the level of II intercostal space, slightly drawing the pleura into the chest at the depth of 7 mm. Small emphysema bullae surrounding the lesion were visible. In the left lung’s apicoposterior segment, calcified fibronodular lesions probably resulting from tuberculosis process completion were visible. In the right pulmonary hilum, a package of enlarged lymph nodes of metastatic origin and app. 24 x 21 x 23 mm in size were visible. In aortopulmonary window, lymph nodes of probable metastatic origin and heterogeneous post-contrast enhancement were also observed. At the level of cervical pleura, in the subclavian area, single lymph nodes with app. 13 mm in the short axis were also visible. The events outcome and causality were not reported.
summary.sendercomment: MAC: Concomitant med Encortin are confounder and provides alternative explanation for the event osteoporosis, and diabetes. Events bronchitis, lung neoplasm malignant, hypotension, radiculopathy, hypotension, peripheral edema and grand mal convulsion are unasseable from reported information. High blood pressure is confounded by medical history of arterial hypertension. Limb ijnury is possibly due to fall caused by grand mall epilepsy.
